items.title: Code completions
items.description: Enhance your coding experience with AI-powered code completions.

items.title: Chat in IDE
items.description: Communicate with Copilot directly within your IDE for instant assistance.

items.title: Chat on mobile
items.description: Get coding assistance on-the-go with Copilot's mobile chat feature.

items.title: CLI assistance
items.description: Streamline your command line tasks with Copilot's CLI assistance.

items.title: Code referencing
items.description: Quickly reference code snippets and examples with Copilot.

items.title: Unit tests
items.description: Automate your testing process with Copilot's unit test generation.

items.title: Code translation
items.description: Translate code across different languages with ease using Copilot.

items.title: Code documentation
items.description: Generate comprehensive documentation for your codebase with Copilot.

items.title: Code explanation
items.description: Get detailed explanations for complex code snippets with Copilot.

items.title: Code fixing
items.description: Quickly fix coding errors and issues with Copilot's assistance.

items.title: Code debugging
items.description: Simplify the debugging process with Copilot's insightful suggestions.

items.title: Slash commands
items.description: Enhance your coding workflow with Copilot's slash commands.

items.title: Integration in Web UI
items.description: Seamlessly integrate Copilot into your web UI for enhanced productivity.

items.title: Chat with your pull request
items.description: Collaborate more effectively on pull requests with Copilot's chat feature.

items.title: Pull request body generation
items.description: Automatically generate detailed pull request bodies with Copilot.

items.title: Chat with knowledge bases
items.description: Access knowledge bases directly through Copilot's chat for quick information retrieval.

items.title: Web search with Bing
items.description: Perform web searches within your coding environment using Copilot and Bing.

items.title: Fine tuned models
items.description: Benefit from models fine-tuned for your specific coding needs with Copilot.

tutorials.title: GitHub Copilot video series: Levels of Enlightenment
tutorials.description: Get more proficient using GitHub Copilot with the lessons learned from Rob. In this 10 part series he explains some of the lessons learned while using Copilot over the last year.

tutorials.title: Converting data into a different format
tutorials.description: Learn how to to leverage GitHub Copilot to help with data conversions.

tutorials.title: How to consume an API without an OpenAPI spec
tutorials.description: Having no official specs to build your object model to communicate with an API can be hard. In this post Jesse shows how to make it easier to get the classes you need using GitHub Copilot

tutorials.title: GitHub Copilot Power User example
tutorials.description: In this post Rob takes you by the hand through refactoring a shell script out of a build pipeline into a separate file. He shows how to do this step by stap, including the additional checks and chat questions he is asking to get to the desired result.

tutorials.title: GitHub Copilot Debugging exprience in Visual Studio
tutorials.description: GitHub Copilot is a powerful integrations in Visual Studio that enhances the debugging experience. Read the blogpost and checkout the videos to learn more!

tutorials.title: GitHub Copilot Chat - Power user example
tutorials.description: Learn in an example how much more you can get out of GitHub Copilot Chat from this video from Rob Bos

levels.title: Explain what you want to achieve
levels.description: This video shows how changing the way you write my code helps me get more descriptive with GitHub Copilot so the suggestions you get out of it become a lot better!

levels.title: Know your context
levels.description: This video shows you how to think about the context GitHub Copilot uses and how to use that knowledge to get better results out of it!

levels.title: Copy method calls as comments
levels.description: This video shows how changing the way you go from a method call to the method implementation speeds up creating code!

levels.title: Top-down programming instead of bottom-up
levels.description: This video shows how thinking about the code implementation from top-down instead of bottom up helps me use GitHub Copilot in a better way!

levels.title: Typos in your prompt do not matter
levels.description: This video shows you to stop caring (to much) about typos in your prompt. Took a while to internalize that this is a good way to speed up your prompting!

levels.title: Use the chat
levels.description: This video shows using the Chat functionality to your benefit: instead of relying on suggestions while you are typing most of the time, I have switched to use the Chat for most of the things, as that will get me faster results so I can focus on what I want to do, instead of creating the right syntax.

levels.title: #file is your biggest friend
levels.description: This video shows you how to get the most of of GitHub Copilot by being very descriptive with your prompts and to include specific context by using #file or #selection, instead of relying on the editor to guess what parts of your codebase are important.

levels.title: Accept the truth
levels.description: This video shows about accepting the fact that Copilot is based on Large Language Models, which means it is both non-deterministic as well as not 100% correct. You remain the pilot and are driving the conversation, so you are also the professional guiding the code in a direction. It can take a while to get the code correct

levels.title: Be smart
levels.description: This video explains that you need to be smart when using GitHub Copilot. Think of novel use cases and how to get more done by Copilot instead of writing the code yourself. Use it for exploration and finding new ways of doing things!
